item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Wednesday, March 5, 2025 at 2:15 PM UTC
item.description:
1. Richard Sutton and Andrew Barto Win 2024 Turing Award (220 points | 37 comments)

6. Private employers added just 77,000 jobs in February, far below expectations (35 points | 6 comments)
7. Why Vermont farmers are using urine on their crops (22 points | 5 comments)

9. Who's Afraid of Peter Thiel? A New Biography Suggests We All Should Be (2021) (86 points | 73 comments)
10. NASA Successfully Acquires GPS Signals on Moon (84 points | 45 comments)
11. How a key ingredient in Coca-Cola, M&M's is smuggled from war-torn Sudan (21 points | 3 comments)

13. Show HN: Bayleaf – Building a low-profile wireless split keyboard (655 points | 218 comments)

20. Brother accused of locking down third-party printer ink cartridges (388 points | 236 comments)
21. Mox – modern, secure, all-in-one email server (396 points | 247 comments)
22. BMW Group Product Catalog–Historic Models (77 points | 37 comments)
23. Translating natural language to first-order logic for logical fallacy detection (238 points | 116 comments)
24. Launch HN: Enhanced Radar (YC W25) – A safety net for air traffic control (150 points | 100 comments)
25. A Map of Python (136 points | 18 comments)
26. The Big Government Contracts Doge Hasn't Touched (28 points | 10 comments)
27. DARPA exploring growing bio structures of "unprecedented size" in microgravity (160 points | 74 comments)
28. They wanted to save us from a dark AI future. Then six people were killed (41 points | 28 comments)
29. Satellogic's Open Satellite Feed (243 points | 12 comments)
